Key Match Events: Georges Mikautadze scored the opening goal from the penalty spot.
Saba Lobjanidze missed a last-minute chance to score.
Patrik Schick scored the equalizing goal for the Czech Republic with his chest.
Patrik Schick got injured and had to leave the pitch.
Post-Match Reflections: Georgia earned its first ever point at a major tournament.
Saba Lobjanidze was comforted by coach Willy Sagnol after missing a crucial chance.
Coach Willy Sagnol expressed mixed feelings but highlighted the significance of earning their first point.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Czech Republic was playing in its eighth consecutive European Championship, while Georgia was making its debut as an independent nation.
Video reviews played a significant role in the match, including a goal by Adam Hlozek that was confirmed after review and a penalty awarded to Georgia after a handball by Czech defender Robin Hranec.
